clap.common.cluster_driver¶

Module Contents¶

class clap.common.cluster_driver.AbstractClusterDriver(*args, **kwargs)¶

Abstract class for implementing a cloud driver. The driver is responsible for managing clusters and nodes and performing operations in the nodes. Also, the driver may manage its own objects (in its own repository) which may refer to its cluster and nodes.

__driver_id__ = DriverID¶
__driver_name__ = Cluster Driver¶
__driver_version__ = 0.1.0¶

abstract exist_cluster(self, cluster_name: str)¶

Check if a cluster exists in the driver’s cluster repository, given its name.

Returns

abstract create_cluster(self, cluster_name: str, config_path: str, *args, **kwargs)¶

Create a new cluster based on a given cluster template

Parameters

  • cluster_name (str) – Name of the cluster to be created

  • config_path (str) – Path to the cluster’s configuration file

  • args – Additional arguments to be used

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to be used

Returns

The return type depends on the driver implementation

Return type

Any

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to be used

abstract get_connection_to_node(self, cluster_name: str, node_name: str, *args, **kwargs)¶

Get an SSH client connected to the node. It is used to perform commands in the node

Parameters

  • cluster_name (str) – Name of the cluster containing the node

  • node_name (str) – Name of the node to get the SSH client

  • args – Additional arguments to be used

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to be used

Returns

A Paramiko SSH Client connected to node

Return type

SSHClient

abstract execute_playbook_in_nodes(self, cluster_name: str, nodes: List[str], playbook_path: str, *args, **kwargs)¶

Execute an Ansible playbook in some nodes

Parameters

  • cluster_name (str) – Name of the cluster containing the nodes

  • nodes (List[str]) – Name of the nodes to execute the playbook

  • playbook_path (str) – Path to the playbook to be executed

  • args – Additional arguments to be used

  • kwargs – Additional keyword to be passed to the Playbook. Keyword key-values turn Ansible variables

Returns

A dictionary with nodes as keys and their values are booleans indicating if the playbook was successfully executed in the node

Return type

Dict[str, bool]

class clap.common.cluster_driver.AbstractInstanceInterface(repository_operator: RepositoryOperations, driver_obj: AbstractClusterDriver)¶

Abstract class implementing the interface between the driver and the clap objects. The interface is responsible for create and manage clusters and nodes entries in the clap platform repository. Clap objects interact with the driver interface instead of the driver directly.

__driver_id__ = DriverID¶

abstract check_nodes_alive(self, node_ids: List[str], *args, **kwargs)¶

Check if some nodes are reachable

Parameters

  • node_ids (List[str]) – ID of the nodes to perform the query

  • args – Additional arguments to be used

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to be used

Returns

A dictionary with node_id as keys and a boolean values indicating if the node is reachable or not

Return type

Dict[str, bool]

abstract get_connection_to_nodes(self, node_ids: List[str], *args, **kwargs)¶

Get SSH client connected to the nodes, used to perform commands.

Parameters

  • node_ids (List[str]) – ID of the nodes to get an SSH connection

  • args – Additional arguments to be used

  • kwargs – Additional keyword arguments to be used

Returns

A dictionary with the node_ids as keys and the values are Paramiko SSH Clients, used to perform operation in the node

Return type

Dict[str, SSHClient]

abstract execute_playbook_in_nodes(self, node_ids: List[str], playbook_path: str, *args, **kwargs)¶

Execute an Ansible playbook in a set of nodes

Parameters

  • node_ids (List[str]) – ID of the nodes to execute the playbook

  • playbook_path (str) – Path to the playbook to be executed

  • args – Additional arguments to be used

  • kwargs – Additional keyword to be passed to the Playbook. Keyword key-values turn Ansible variables

Returns

A dictionary with nodes as keys and their values are booleans indicating if the playbook was successfully executed in the node

Return type

Dict[str, bool]

class clap.common.cluster_driver.Codes¶

Status codes for modules and nodes

NODE_STATUS_INIT = initialized¶
NODE_STATUS_UNREACHABLE = unreachable¶
NODE_STATUS_REACHABLE = reachable¶
NODE_STATUS_PAUSED = paused¶
NODE_STATUS_STOPPED = stopped¶
